dict.string: Today is 12 days, which are one week and five days, of the Omer.
Hoy es doce días, que son una semana y cinco días del Omer.
Aujourd'hui est douze jours, qui sont une semaine et cinq jours du Omer
СЕГОДНЯ ДВЕНАДЦАТЬ ДНЕЙ - ЧТО СОСТАВЛЯЕТ ОДНУ НЕДЕЛЮ И ПЯТЬ ДНЕЙ - ОМЕРА.
הַיּוֹם שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר יוֹם שֶׁהֵם שָׁבֽוּעַ אֶחָד וַחֲמִשָּׁה יָמִים לָעֽוֹמֶר
Hod ShebeGevurah
Hod ShebeGevura
Hod chebiGuevoura
ОЙД ШЕБЕ-ГВУРО
הוֹד שֶׁבִּגְבוּרָה
Hod of Gevurah
Humility in Discipline

The results of discipline and might without humility are obvious. The greatest catastrophes have occurred as a result of people sitting in arrogant judgment of others.
A judge has to be the most humble of creatures, recognizing that he sits in judgment not by his own merit, but only because G-d gave him the right to judge His children.
The Farmer of Chelm: A Lesson in Subjectivity
Rabbi Simon Jacobson tells a very funny Chassidic story with a clear lesson about objectivity and subjectivity. Lighten your mood while you gain an honest perspective on your own inner landscape.
https://youtu.be/Ncc6VfvL0EE
Before judging anyone, insure that you are doing so selflessly with no personal bias.
Am I arrogant in the name of justice (what I consider as just)?
Do I ever think that I sit on a higher pedestal and bestow judgment on my subjects below?
What about my children? Students?
A judge has to be the most humble of creatures, recognizing that he sits in judgment not by his own merit, but only because G-d gave him the right to judge His children.
